claim: Flublok is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).

extracted_evidence.quote: Each of the three HAs is expressed in this cell line using a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further purified by column chromatography.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote explicitly states that the hemagglutinin (HA) proteins are expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus vector, directly supporting the claim about the novel production platform (BEVS).

extracted_evidence.quote: Each of the three HAs is expressed in this cell line using a baculovirus vector (Autographa californica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further purified by column chromatography. The purified HAs are then blended and filled into single dose syringes.
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote details the use of a baculovirus vector system in the production of recombinant HA in insect cells, confirming the claim about the BEVS platform.

extracted_evidence.quote: Each 0.5 mL dose of Flublok may also contain residual amounts of baculovirus and Spodoptera frugiperda cell proteins (≤14.3 mcg), baculovirus and cellular DNA (≤10 ng), and Triton X-100 (≤100 mcg).
extracted_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote provides supporting evidence that baculovirus and insect cell components are present in the final product, which is consistent with the use of a baculovirus expression vector system in insect cells.
